tit.cmt: タイトルのため単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 中原氏（なかはらし）は日本の古代から近世までの貴族の氏。
sen.e: The Nakahara clan was a group of noble families sharing the same ancestor, which existed from ancient era to the early-modern times in Japan.
The Nakahara clan was a group of noble families sharing the same ancestor, which existed from ancient times to the early-modern times in Japan.
The Nakahara clan was a group of noble families sharing the same ancestor, which existed from ancient times to the early-modern times in Japan.

sen.j: 安寧天皇の第三皇子である磯城津彦命が源流と言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the clan was descended from Shikitsuhiko no Mikoto, the third prince of Emperor Annei.
It is said that the clan was descended from Shikitsuhiko no Mikoto, the third prince of Emperor Annei.
It is said that the clan was descended from Shikitsuhiko no Mikoto, the third prince of Emperor Annei.

sen.j: はじめは十市氏首 (姓)であったが、971年に十市有象・十市以忠が中原宿禰姓に改め、974年に中原朝臣姓を賜ったことに始まった。
sen.e: At fist, they had called themselves Tochi(shi) no obito (with 'obito' being "kabane," or hereditary title), but the Nakahara clan was established when Usho TOCHI and Ichu TOCHI changed their name to Nakahara no sukune (with 'sukune' being newly introduced kabane) in 971 and was bestowed with "asomi" (higher kabane than sukune) in 974, thus becoming Nakahara no asomi.
sen.cmt: 「十市氏首」の「首]は「おびと」と読むものと思いそう翻訳しました。ご確認下さい。 「十市有象・十市以忠」は調べても読みがわからなかったので"Usho TOCHI and Ichu TOCHI "としましたが、こちらもご確認をお願いします。
sen.e: At first, they called themselves Tochi(shi) no obito (with 'obito' being "kabane," or hereditary title), but the Nakahara clan was established when Usho TOCHI and Ichu TOCHI changed their name to Nakahara no sukune (with 'sukune' being newly introduced kabane) in 971 and was bestowed with "asomi" (higher kabane than sukune) in 974, thus becoming Nakahara no asomi.

At first, they called themselves Tochi no obito (with 'obito' being "kabane," or hereditary title), but the Nakahara clan was established when Usho TOCHI (十市有象) and Ichu TOCHI (十市以忠) changed their name to Nakahara no sukune (with 'sukune' being newly introduced kabane) in 971 and was bestowed with "asomi" (higher kabane than sukune) in 974, thus becoming Nakahara no asomi.
sen.cmt: Tochi(shi)→Tochiのみとし、読みが不確かなため、Usho TOCHI (十市有象)、Ichu TOCHI (十市以忠)としました。

sen.j: 中原氏は明法道、明経道を司る家系で、大外記、少外記を世襲職とする朝廷の官務家として長く続いた。
sen.e: The Nakahara clan was specialized in "Myobodo" (the study of Codes) and "Myogo-do" (the study of Confucian classics) and maintained for a long time its status as the "Kanmu"(a provider of official services) family for the Imperial court by inheriting positions "Daigeki" (senior secretary in charge of official documents) and "Shogeki" (junior secretary in charge of official documents).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Nakahara clan was specialized in "Myobodo" (the study of Codes) and "Myogo-do" (the study of Confucian classics) and maintained for a long time its status as the "Kanmu"(a provider of official services) family for the Imperial court by inheriting positions "Daigeki" (senior secretary in charge of official documents) and "Shogeki" (junior secretary in charge of official documents).

The Nakahara clan was specialized in Myobodo (the study of Codes) and Myogyodo (the study of Confucian classics) and maintained for a long time its status as the Kanmu(a provider of official services) family for the Imperial court by inheriting positions Daigeki (senior secretary in charge of official documents) and Shogeki (junior secretary in charge of official documents).
sen.cmt: Myogo-do→Myogyodoに修正、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 中世には、中原親能のように鎌倉幕府と関係を持つようになった。
sen.e: In the Medieval Period, members of the clan such as NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi came to have contacts with the "Kamakura bakufu" (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Medieval Period, members of the clan such as NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi came to have contacts with the "Kamakura bakufu" (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
During the Medieval Period, members of the clan such as NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi came to have contacts with the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除
